instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi guys,

I have this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with a freezing issue. I installed a new OS and checked the board no liquid or anything on it. Sometimes it works fine all day, but sometimes when I wanna make a restart it will freeze. Any ideas? 

Thanks

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Can we know what exact board do you have there?

You should try known good battery and clean ME BIOS.
Also check all <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signals.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: The board is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. I noticed when plugged in on an external monitor it restarts and shuts down every time. Now i just plugged in the charger again but only on it's own lcd and once i click shut down the color spinning ball gets stuck and nothing happens and it's not completely frozen

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Has the same behavior with external monitor on both left/right ports?

What happens if you click restart, instead of shut down?

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: All port external connections it's the same. Only takes the shut down and restart when it's connected externally. I also tried another LCD Assembly it's the same, gets stuck when on the internal screen. Temps are fine normal levels. When connected with external it has 2-3sec delay once pressed restart or shut down and it will continue not get stuck

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
You may have a graphics problem, on iGPU side.
When external monitor is connected, discrete GPU is enabled.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Any way to turn it off?

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
No way to disable Intel graphics.
You don't have problems with discrete GPU, as machine stays on with external monitor.

If works always correctly with both internal/external screens connected?

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
I tried a software to run only on discrete GPU but freezes sometimes when running on its LCD with the software on. When plugged in externally with the software running or not all works well. I advised the client and they will probably use it externally at the office. It's a pity the MacBook it's in excellent condition and not used a lot it's brand new. 

Thanks for the assistance :)
